title: krishnaverma
author: krishnaverma
content: How much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: None to date in my opinion. For me to become a weak hands the situation that would trigger me to sell would have to be an almost unrealistic situation, like bitcoin going down to $1,000 in 24 hours or something like that. But that is a scenario that is not going to happen, especially with the bullishness of the coming year. In fact I see the recent dip as a good opportunity to keep accumulating. The fools who are selling will regret it.

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .Weak hands are always weak hands and they will be weak whenever Bitcoin has corrections. Weak hands can change if these people change their minds after experiencing this market more, and understanding more about this market operation as well as about Bitcoin market history.It will be affected in percent, like - 10%, -20%, -30% correction and people will care less about drop in $. It's important if they lose in $ but I imply that they will be fearful mostly because of how many percent their portfolio drops in one day or during a correction.Sometimes, if they're holder but are traders with leverages, their hands will become much weaker. Exchanges always wait for market corrections to liquidate leveraged positions of users and don't care their customers whether have strong hands or weak hands.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .If you were able to anticipate the drop and the market is acting exactly as you have predicted, then I'm very sure that you would not be worried or think too much because you are also pretty sure that the market will rebound back to the formal ATH and form a new ATH afterwards. This drop is likely due to the festive season; with lots of people selling off for the holidays, there is no need to quake about it because there is still good time ahead from January and 2025 still holds promises.Don't be a weak hand, selling due to no important reason. If you are trading bitcoins for fiat in this period, it should be for a good reason.

comments.author: AVE5
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .There's no specific value but the fact is that for investors values on bitcoin to drop so weakly, then there must be a high value of depreciation in the market.Note: Bitcoin isn't like the Memecoins than dips in a matter of short time.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: I ever experienced in 2021 and 2022 where Bitcoin price drop from $67K to $20K, not sure how big was the drop in 24 hours, probably 20%? but I still keep holding until now. I think it's hard to see Bitcoin price down 20% when the price is already big enough right now.Even Bitcoin Bitcoin price drop 50% in 24 hours, I'm sure I will keep holding.

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .I’m not relying to the percentage rather if the price is already on the critical level of breaking a strong support. A simple price decrease amount is nothing since Bitcoin is already high. It’s nonsense to become a weak hands after the price decrease by 10K while it’s still hanging strong on a price support.Looking at the chart and rely on support and resistance is still the best way to determine whether you need to sell or still hold.But in long term, holding is still the best option.

comments.author: Natalim
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .This is the good thing about bitcoin, it won’t make a drastic fall without a reason behind it. In short, even if a major correction occurs and btc price drops deeply, dropping below $10k is highly impossible. That won’t never happen again. Strong hands will remain strong because they’ve seen the real potentials of bitcoin, while weak hands will always be weak because they don’t have the confidence to trust the movement of bitcoin.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: remember folks.. price drop = discount.. not dismountdiscount is a buying opportunity not a opportunity to jump off and leave#BuyLowSellHigh

comments.author: Smartprofit
comments.body: I have been trading in the cryptocurrency market since spring 2017 and I have seen various market movements. I have come to two conclusions regarding Bitcoin. The first conclusion is that the Bitcoin price is growing in the long term, so buying the first cryptocurrency at any price will eventually lead to profit. The second conclusion is that a fall in the Bitcoin price is the best time to buy the first cryptocurrency. I have seen the Bitcoin price fall from $ 19,000 to $ 3,500 (over 2 years). I have seen the first cryptocurrency fall from $ 5,000 to $ 3,000, which happened in just 24 hours. It is very difficult to surprise me. If the Bitcoin price fell today, then in the future it will certainly grow. There is no point in worrying.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .With the information I have gathered about the past price movement of Bitcoin, it will be difficult for me to sell off due to a drop in price. There will always be a correction and the price will rise to exceed the last highest price. I would rather wait for another bull run than rush to sell my coin at a loss. From historical information, the peak of the Bull run will be next year and this one will be an uncommon one. So I am hodling strong because my ears and eyes are closed to the tension that is currently around the market.

comments.author: Iranus
comments.body: It depends because whenever there is a major correction there is always a reason behind it.  If it's not because the US government bans bitcoin or someone finds a vulnerability in the bitcoin blockchain...Overall, if it's not news that affects the future of bitcoin, I don't think there's anything scary enough to make me panic and dump my bitcoins. On the contrary, if the cause is war or collapse similar to FTX, Mt.gox causing bitcoin to be dumped, then it is an opportunity to buy at a high discount, not a time to panic.Also, if you invest with an amount that you can afford to lose and you have enough faith in bitcoin, I am sure you will see no reason to sell your bitcoins no matter what bad happens.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .To each their risk tolerance level, that's all I can say. However, to cap it all, anyone selling now; no matter the perceived dip in the market isn't getting it right. This is just a correction, a cool off period for Bitcoin. That's why I said anyone selling now is going to miss out big time; except they're selling to buy the dip.I can take my risk cashing out on alts with the aim of buying back but I dare not try it with Bitcoin. No matter the dump now, I ain't panicking to sell off. I can begin to consider selling off once my targeted level is reached. Until Bitcoin does more than $68k X 2, I won't bother with whatever signals of dump the market is presenting.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .Absolutely nothing.  As a financial advisor one thing that I share with my client often is to never panic sell is something that you believe in and believe will continue to bounce back/do well eventually.Technically you never lost anything until you sell, until then it's simply considered an "unrealized loss".  As long as you still have the coins, you have the ability to grow that balance back.  So just like most stock portfolio's set for the mid-large term run, I'm going to let it ride all that way.

comments.author: Emmanuel_Pounds
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time . I have witnessed bitcoin massive dip within 24hrs and I still kept my holdings in good faith that it will recover which it did. The only measure I kept in place is that I keep buying using DCA. So, I don't think little correction like this can give me a weak hands. Its even an opportunity for me as I able to grab more units through limit entry on my BingX portfolio.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Before you buy bitcoin, make sure you do research. If you are not expecting retracement or correction which can happen at times, do not buy bitcoin. Just like this time that we are still in the bull run market, you do not need to panic at all. The price may fall but it will rise back.  No matter how much the price fall, I will prefer to buy more bitcoin instead until mid 2025.

comments.author: freedomgo
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .Well, if after that 24 or 48 hours bitcoin price still fail to recover but drops more consistently instead, maybe that would be a signal to turn into weak hands. Let's say price drops into $20k from the current btc price, that's already too far to mark.However, this is not always the case with bitcoin. We may often see bitcoin surprise us with a new all time high, but it's just very rare for bitcoin to drop its price 50x or 80x from its original price. Bitcoin would not have been the most prominent, most reliable and most profitable crypto in the market if that's the usual price pattern for bitcoin.

comments.author: EL MOHA
comments.body: Quote from: Jawhead999 on December 20, 2024, 03:29:41 PMI ever experienced in 2021 and 2022 where Bitcoin price drop from $67K to $20K, not sure how big was the drop in 24 hours, probably 20%? but I still keep holding until now. I think it's hard to see Bitcoin price down 20% when the price is already big enough right now.Even Bitcoin Bitcoin price drop 50% in 24 hours, I'm sure I will keep holding.For exact number it was below $20k and was at $15k around December 2022 and just like now people were spreading more rumors of it going further down to like $10k yet this doesn’t stop many people, in fact most of the bitcoin enthusiasts were even happy to have it at such dip as it gives them opportunity to buy more, I kept telling people that not that bitcoin doesn’t have weak hands but it’s weak hands are very few. Price fluctuations like this doesn’t scare them much, Although it will be hard to even get a 15% drop in 24 hours it is possible to get a 50% in a bearish period and that still won’t scare people. 50% from here is even just around $48k which is a price we have been to before, so for me right now I don’t see any price drop that will also turn me to a weak hand because I know it would bounce back this isn’t a shitcoin where a drop like that can brings its crash

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .I will not sell it and will not change any plans as long as I believe in the current cycle. If we are already at the end of the bull cycle - then it is possible to sell everything instead of some or gradually. I've survived this far without taking profits when I see profits - so there's no reason for me to be a weak hand just because of a drop in price.However, one thing is certain - each of us has a different tolerance for risk. Some are optimistic about the future, they will hold - while others will cut their losses and sell during a downturn. Optimists don't sell until their targets are reached - while doubters exit and even have to accept some losses due selling during a downturn.

comments.author: btc78
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 20, 2024, 03:08:23 PMHow much drop in Bitcoin price in 24 hours is enough to convert into weak hands ? We all have some trigger point ? Even if you are a firm believer in crypto, it can be hard to remain invested if there is major correction in price over very short period of time .what do you mean?are you asking if i’ll lose belief in bitcoin if it drops a certain price? well i do not think so to be frank if bitcoin’s price drops the first thing i would do is buy more because i have been meaning to do so though if it drops all of a sudden i would try to understand first why and then decide whether to continue buying or is the project dead (very unlikely)
